channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: For Gene Hackman, a Jarring End to a Quiet, Art-Filled Life in Santa Fe
item.description: Mr. Hackman, who was found dead with his wife and one of their dogs, had written novels and painted since leaving Hollywood behind for retirement in N...

item.title: Iowa Moves to Eliminate Trans Rights, and Zelensky Heads to the White House
item.description: Plus, Conan O’Brien on hosting the Oscars.

item.title: What We Know About Gene Hackman’s Death
item.description: Mr. Hackman was found dead inside his home, along with his wife and a dog. The sheriff’s office in Santa Fe, N.M., is investigating.

item.title: Vietnamese Journalist Gets 2 ½ Years in Prison for Facebook Posts
item.description: The sentence for Truong Huy San, an influential reporter, was the latest crackdown on speech by Vietnam, a rising regional power.

item.title: Wall Street worried that new tariffs will turn the Trump bump into a slump—analysts warn the bulk of action is yet to come
item.description: Even unfilled tariff threats are beginning to alter consumer and business behavior, with markets stumbling on news of yet more sanctions on China.

item.title: With a Letter From King Charles, Starmer Was Welcomed Into Trump’s Court
item.description: The British prime minister, Keir Starmer, presented President Trump with a royal invitation and scored several political wins. But his top goal — a se...

item.title: With a Letter From King Charles, Starmer Was Welcomed Into Trump’s Court
item.description: The British prime minister, Keir Starmer, presented President Trump with a royal invitation and scored several political wins. But his top goal — a se...

item.title: Prada heiress who took the fashion label to new highs with Miu Miu, is eyeing Versace—but she won’t be the only one
item.description: “Versace is on everyone’s table,” said Miuccia Prada, the owner of the eponymous brand founded by her grandfather.

item.title: Why ‘Emilia Pérez,’ a Film About Mexico, Flopped in Mexico
item.description: The polarizing movie is up for 13 Academy Awards on Sunday. But in Mexico, it has been widely criticized for its depiction of the country.

item.title: U.S. Terminates Funding for Polio, H.I.V., Malaria and Nutrition Programs Around the World
item.description: Here are some of the 5,800 contracts the Trump administration formally canceled this week in a wave of terse emails.

item.title: GSK could double CEO Emma Walmsley’s pay to $27 million in bid to bring U.K. exec salaries in line with the U.S.
item.description: The British pharma giant said Emma Walmsley's current pay could put off candidates for her eventual successor.

item.title: Why AT&T’s CFO is hoping Congress will extend Trump’s corporate tax cuts
item.description: The Tax Cuts and Jobs Act factors into how companies are determining future planning.

item.title: No Trains, No Planes, and Huge Protests: Strike Brings Greece to a Halt
item.description: Two years after the country’s deadliest rail disaster, many are still demanding greater safety and accountability.

item.title: Nvidia says America’s trade war with China is hurting revenue, warning Trump’s tariffs have added a big ‘unknown’ to its future outlook
item.description: CEO Jensen Huang said Nvidia sales in China are half of what they were before export controls.

item.title: Why ‘Emilia Pérez,’ a Film About Mexico, Flopped in Mexico
item.description: The polarizing movie is up for 13 Academy Awards on Sunday. But in Mexico, it has been widely criticized for its depiction of the country.
